question: The Indian Army has leased four Heron unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs) from which country?
explanation:
The Indian Army has leased four Heron unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs) made by Israel Aerospace Industries (IAI).
The aerial vehicles are likely to be deployed along the 3,488-km India-China border. The lease period is for three years and the company will deliver the medium-altitude long endurance UAVs between August and December.
